borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The bulk, mass, scale, sitting and design of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearing and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, particularly no.72 Rosedale Road. The side extension abuts the shared boundary and generates an overbearing impact to the habitable rooms on ground and first floor levels resulting in a material loss of outlook, daylight and sunlight.  The proposal constitutes unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The bulk, mass, scale, sitting and design of the proposed development would be an undesirable addition which would disrupt the openness of the built form of the terrace rows along Rosedale Road. The side extension would be an insubordinate addition to the original dwelling and is out-of-keeping with the modest-sized dwellings along Rosedale Road.  The combination of the existing and proposed extensions and the mismatched roof forms appear the dwelling to be overdeveloped which is harmful to the appearance of the original dwelling and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate.  As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a part two storey part single storey side extension
